title: Ureteral Metastasis from Wilms Tumor
abstract: No AccessJournal of Urology1 Apr 1976Ureteral Metastasis from Wilms Tumor Peter S. Stevens, and H.B. Eckstein Peter S. StevensPeter S. Stevens More articles by this author , and H.B. Eckstein More articles by this author View All Author Informationhttps://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-5347(17)59245-9AboutPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissionsReprints ShareFacebookLinked InTwitterEmail Urothelial spread of Wilms tumor is uncommon and only 5 instances of ureteral metastases have been reported previously. A case of Wilms tumor with mid ureteral metastasis is presented and the literature is reviewed. Clinical implications and suggestions for surgical management are discussed. © 1976 by The American Urological Association Education and Research, Inc.FiguresReferencesRelatedDetailsCited ByStanley K, Khoudary K and Nasrallah P (2018) Urothelial Extension of Wilms Tumor Presenting as a Prolapsing Urethral MassJournal of Urology, VOL. 153, NO. 6, (1981-1983), Online publication date: 1-Jun-1995.Niu C, Fen Chen W, Chuang J, Tsan-Jung Y, Wan Y and Chen W (2018) Intrapelvic Wilms Tumor: Report of 2 Cases and Review of the LiteratureJournal of Urology, VOL. 150, NO. 3, (936-939), Online publication date: 1-Sep-1993.Wicklund R and Tank E (2018) Polypoid Renal Pelvic Lesions in ChildrenJournal of Urology, VOL. 123, NO. 6, (943-944), Online publication date: 1-Jun-1980.Ehrlich R, Bloomberg S, Gyepes M, Levitt S, Kogan S, Hanna M and Goodwin W (2018) Wilms Tumor, Misdiagnosed Preoperatively: A Review of 19 National Wilms Tumor Study I CasesJournal of Urology, VOL. 122, NO. 6, (790-792), Online publication date: 1-Dec-1979.Bissada N and Finkbeiner A (2018) Ureteral Stump Metastases from Renal AdenocarcinomaJournal of Urology, VOL. 118, NO. 2, (327-328), Online publication date: 1-Aug-1977.
